titleStmt.title: Register for Amphikrates the tripod carrier in the fourth Pythais

div.p:
For the Good Fortune of the Council and the People of the Athenians.
In the archonship of Mentor at Delphi and in Athens
of Argeios (97/6), (he who) took the sacred tripod from Delphi and
carried it away, and led the fire-bearer (is) Amphikrates
son of Epistratos, Athenian.

!+1+ This text, inscribed on the southern fa√ßade of the Athenian Treasury, is likely to serve as the preamble of an honorific decree. It was engraved right below the list of magistrates organising the fourth Pythais in 97/6 BC (F.Delphes III 2, 6) and near the other lists of participants in this Pythais (F.Delphes III 2, 2, 6, 10, 16, 17, 26, 31, 45). On the Pythais and the Treasury, see F.Delphes III 2, 3, on Attic inscriptions at Delphi, see IG II3 4, 17 with notes, and on the fourth Pythais .
